questions.question_text:
You create an Azure subscription named Subscription1 and an associated Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named Tenant1.
Tenant1 contains the users in the following table.
//IMG//

You need to add an Azure AD Privileged Identity Management application to Tenant1.
Which account can you use?

discussion.content: why not ContosoAdmin1@hotmail.com with Owner role?

The answer is almost correct. There is no External Collaboration Setting under the "Users" blade, however, the mentioned settings can be accessed from either the "External Identities" blade or "User Settings" blade, not the "Users" blade.

choices.D: From the Custom domain names blade, add a custom domain
choices.B: From the Users blade, modify the External collaboration settings
choices.A: From the Roles and administrators blade, assign the Security administrator role to Admin1.
choices.C: From the Organizational relationship blade, add an identity provider

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named contoso.onmicorosft.com.
The User administrator role is assigned to a user named Admin1. An external partner has a Microsoft account that uses the user1@outlook.com sign in.
Admin1 attempts to invite the external partner to sign in to the Azure AD tenant and receives the following error message: "Unable to invite user user1@outlook.com- Generic authorization exception."
You need to ensure that Admin1 can invite the external partner to sign in to the Azure AD tenant.
What should you do?

choices.C: Transfer the administration of Subscription1 to a global administrator of Tenant2
choices.A: Create and link a subscription to Tenant2.
choices.B: Configure the MFA Server setting in Tenant1

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure subscription named Subscription1 and two Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenants named Tenant1 and Tenant2.
Subscription1 is associated to Tenant1. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for all the users in Tenant1.
You need to enable MFA for the users in Tenant2. The solution must maintain MFA for Tenant1.
What should you do first?

choices.D: The user entered an incorrect PIN for time within 10 minutes
choices.A: The user reported a fraud alert when prompted for additional authentication
choices.C: An administrator manually blocked the user

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have an Azure subscription named Subscription1 that has a subscription ID of c276fc76-9cd4-44c9-99a7-4fd71546436e.
You need to create a custom RBAC role named CR1 that meets the following requirements:
✑ Can be assigned only to the resource groups in Subscription1
✑ Prevents the management of the access permissions for the resource groups
✑ Allows the viewing, creating, modifying, and deleting of resources within the resource groups
What should you specify in the assignable scopes and the permission elements of the definition of CR1? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
